item.title: Series of tools for consultants: Darkfield Laser Mouse
item.description:
Being a roving consultant means you’ve likely developed a toolkit of methods and technologies to stay productive in diverse settings. This can involve working from a spare desk at the office, client sites, airports, airplanes, and countless coffee shops. Over the years, this might have included using floppy disks, managing old databases, handling large files, establishing VPN connections from unusual locations, and even resorting to makeshift workstations. I’ve certainly encountered my share of unique challenges, and I’d like to share some solutions I’ve gathered over time...

item.title: Tools for Consultants: 7-Zip
item.description:
While I try to stay current with technology, I sometimes miss valuable tools, especially in unfamiliar areas. I’ve relied on WinZip for years to email files, even paying for a license! For compressing larger files like SQL Server and VHD backups, I’ve been using WinRAR. I believed these two programs covered my compression needs effectively. However, I recently came across a free, open-source compression utility called 7-Zip, which many of my peers were already familiar with...

item.description:

item.title: Tools for Consultants: WinDirStat
item.description:
Experiencing an unexpectedly full hard drive or needing to free up space can be frustrating. WinDirStat is a free, lightweight application that provides disk usage information and can be incredibly helpful in these situations. While large, affordable hard drives are becoming the norm, laptop and server drives often have limited space and can fill up with large files. Outdated SQL Server backups and large SQL Server database files are common culprits on servers, while desktops and laptops have their own share of space-hogging files...
